str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To imprison, deliver into custody. From phulax; to incarcerate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To flay, flog, scourge, beat. A primary verb; properly, to flay, i.e. to scourge, or to thrash.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
